articles.title: Ri Yong Ho Meets Cambodian Ambassador
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho Meets Cambodian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho Tuesday had a talk with Op Sisawada, outgoing Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK.
					 Ri mentioned the DPRK government's principled stand to glorify and develop through generations to come the history of friendship between the two countries, provided under the fraternal relationship forged between President Kim Il Sung and great King Norodom Sihanouk.
					
					 He hoped that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would further strengthen in various fields.
					
					 The Cambodian ambassador said that the relationship between the two countries is the historic ties of friendship forged personally by the great King Norodom Sihanouk and President Kim Il Sung and it is the consistent stand of the Cambodian government to carry forward and develop this precious tradition.
					
					 He added that he would always cherish the friendly feelings of the DPRK government and people toward the Cambodian government and people and continue to strive for the development of the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation.

articles.title: 21st Kimjongilia Festival Opens
articles.content:
21st Kimjongilia Festival Opens
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The 21st Kimjongilia Festival opened with due ceremony at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition here Tuesday to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Its theme is "Kimjongilia in full bloom wishing for eternal prosperity of the era of Kim Jong Un".
					
					 On show at the venue of the festival are tens of thousands of potted Kimjongilias cultivated by more than 80 units, including armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons, civilians from all walks of life and school youth and children.
					
					 Also on display are flowers presented by overseas compatriots' organizations including the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), overseas compatriots, diplomatic missions of various countries and international bodies here, friendship and solidarity organizations of and personages of different countries and Korea-resident Chinese.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, vice-chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Ryong Nam, vice-premier of the Cabinet, and officials of the festival organizing committee and the units which presented flowers to the festival.
					
					 Also, attending it were a congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star led by Ri Ki Sok, advisor to the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, and other overseas compatriots' delegations, members of the associations for disseminating the immortal flower and foreign guests.
					
					 Kim Chang Do, chairman of the Korea Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee, made an opening address.

articles.title: Oath-taking Gathering of Youth and Students Held
articles.content:
Oath-taking Gathering of Youth and Students Held 
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Youth and students on Tuesday held a meeting to vow to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal sun of Juche and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un at the plaza of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il, the Day of the Shining Star.
					 Attending it were officials of the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League, officials concerned and youth and students in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants paid tribute to the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the C.C., youth league, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that Kim Jong Il who was always concerned for the issue of the youth developed the youth league into a vanguard shining with the august name of Kim Il Sung, handed over the torch of the revolution to the youth and made the great history of the policy of prioritizing the youth rare to be found in the world.
					
					 They referred to the fact that Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the exploits the peerlessly great men performed in building a youth power developed the youth league into the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League and has wisely led the youth to creditably fulfill its honorable mission and duty before the Party and revolution as befitting the reliable reserves, advancing group and a wing of the WPK.
					
					 They expressed their will to build a prosperous socialist power of Juche on this land true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un as befitting the descendants of Kim Il Sung and soldiers and disciples of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan Gives Premiere Performance
articles.content:
Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan Gives Premiere Performance
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A music and dance performance was given by the art troupe of Koreans in Japan to celebrate the Day of the Shining Star, birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, at the Pyongyang Grand Theater Tuesday.
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers reflecting the loyalty of officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and Koreans in Japan to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal sun of the great Paektusan nation for all ages and to invariably follow the road of patriotism under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The performance that added to the enthusiasm of praising the great men was acclaimed by audiences for its high ideological value and artistry.
					
					 Officials concerned and working citizens enjoyed the performance.
					
					 The performance goes on.

articles.title: 22nd Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions Closes
articles.content:
22nd Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions Closes
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The 22nd Paektusan Prize Sports Contest among Officials of National Institutions which began since Jan. 23 closed with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Feb. 14.
					 The players competed with each other in ten sports events, divided into four groups.
					
					 Teams of the Ministry of Electric Power Industry, the Maritime Administration of the DPRK, the Taesong Guidance Bureau and the Mansudae Art Studio won in the men's basketball matches, teams of the  Ministry of Land and Environment Protection, the Central Public Prosecutors Office, the Taehung Guidance Bureau and the Radio and TV Broadcasting Committee of the DPRK in the men's volleyball matches and  teams of the Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport, the Ministry of Finance, the Myohyang Guidance Bureau and  the Korean Revolution Museum in the women's volleyball matches.
					
					 Teams of the Ministry of Railways, the Taesong Bank, the Taehung Guidance Bureau and the Foreign Languages Publishing House came first in the tug of war and the Taekwon-do matches and teams of the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications,  the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, the Unha Guidance Bureau and the  Sci-Tech Complex in  shooting matches, 
					
					 Coming top in the team standings were teams of the State Planning Commission, the Taesong Bank, the Taehung Guidance Bureau and the Foreign Languages Publishing House.

articles.title: Celebration Events Held by Working People's Organizations
articles.content:
Celebration Events Held by Working People's Organizations
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held and a performance was given by the working people's organizations on Tuesday on the occasion of the 75th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were officials concerned, officials of the General Federation of Trade Union of Korea (GFTUK) and the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK), workers, trade union members, agricultural workers and members of the UAWK.
					
					 Ju Yong Gil, chairman of the C.C., GFTUK, made a report at the meeting held at the Central Hall of Workers to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that the birth of Kim Jong Il as the Shining Star of Mt Paektu was a great fortune for the nation that opened up a bright future of the revolutionary cause of Juche and an event of world historic significance as it promised the bright future of the human cause of independence.
					
					 They noted that Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career was the most brilliant one of the peerlessly great man who saved the destiny of the nation with the high mission for the country and revolution, iron will, foresightedness and outstanding leadership and devoted his all to the happiness of the people.
					
					 They called for holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal sun of Juche for all ages and dynamically advancing towards the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche, united close around respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Agricultural workers and members of the UAWK held a meeting at the Hall of Culture in Kwaksan County.
					
					 Then a performance was given in celebration of the anniversary.
					
					 The performers praised Kim Jong Il for making marches of devotion for the prosperity of the country and the happiness of its people all his life and opening up a broad avenue to the eternal happiness and prosperity of Kim Il Sung's nation.

articles.title: Diplomatic Envoys, Representatives of Int'l Bodies Visit Venue of Kimjongilia Festival
articles.content:
Diplomatic Envoys, Representatives of Int'l Bodies Visit Venue of Kimjongilia Festival
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here Tuesday visited the venue of the 21st Kimjongilia Festival on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					They looked round the venue of the festival full of immortal flowers which represented ardent reverence of Koreans and world progressives for Kim Jong Il. 
					
					On the same day, they toured the Pyongyang Cultural Exhibition.

articles.title: Literary Prize Conferred upon Schoolchildren
articles.content:
Literary Prize Conferred upon Schoolchildren
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Our Classroom Literary Prize was awarded to schoolchildren with the approach of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The above-said prize went to more than 400 schoolchildren, including Choe Song Rim at Kumsong Middle School No. 1 and Kim Sin A at Changgwang Senior Middle School in Central District of Pyongyang City, at an awarding ceremony held at the hall of the youth league Tuesday.
					
					 They wrote child poems and other literary pieces reflecting the schoolchildren's ardent yearning for Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, who devoted their all to the happiness of the younger generations and their rosy future, and representing respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's warm love for posterity. 
					
					 Their writings also include children's songs, poems and stories dealing with the pride of schoolchildren who see their hopes coming true with nothing to desire more in the world.

articles.title: International Kim Jong Il Prize Conferred on Japanese
articles.content:
International Kim Jong Il Prize Conferred on Japanese
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The International Kim Jong Il Prize was conferred on Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					 He ardently followed the Juche idea and rendered distinguished services to realizing global independence and accomplishing the cause of global peace.
					
					 The International Kim Jong Il Prize Council made public a relevant decision on Tuesday.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests and overseas compatriots visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.
					 They included the secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and his party, the economic and commercial councilors corps here, staff members of UNDP, WFP, WHO, FAO and United Nations Population Fund and UNICEF missions here and the participants in the 21st Kimjongilia Festival, 
					
					 The visitors laid floral baskets before the statues and paid tribute to the great leaders.
					
					 The statues were also visited by a congratulatory group of the General Association of Koreans in China, a delegation of the Association of Korean Business Persons in China, a delegation of the Association for Economic and Cultural Exchange of Korean Nationality in Dandong City of China and family members of persons related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle from abroad.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Meet
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Meet
 Chongjin, February 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign crewmen met at Chongjin Port on Tuesday with the approaching of the 75th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting by captains and crewmen of the Tanzania-flagged ship Everbraght and Mongolia-flagged ship Gloryhope-6.
					
					 Speakers said that Kim Jong Il's whole life is the brilliant one of the prominent revolutionary, peerless patriot and benevolent father of the Korean people who devoted his all to the country and the people.
					
					 They referred to the fact that he had turned the DPRK into a politico-ideological power and world military power without an equal in the world and the satellite power of Juche under the unfurled banner of Songun for more than half a century.
					
					 They stressed that his exploits on behalf of the times and history would be eternally kept in the minds of the Korean people and world progressives.
					
					 A letter to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Military Attaches Corps Visits National Gifts Exhibition House
articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Visits National Gifts Exhibition House
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited the National Gifts Exhibition House on Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 At the general review room members of the corps paid tribute to the statues of smiling Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Being briefed on the fact that the house was successfully built as the eternal treasure of Kim Il Sung's nation, they looked round the gifts presented by Korean people, overseas compatriots and south Koreans to the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu.
					
					 Earlier, they visited the Pyongyang Kim Jong Suk Silk Mill.

articles.title: Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps Visits Ryugyong General Ophthalmic Hospital
articles.content:
Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps Visits Ryugyong General Ophthalmic Hospital
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors corps here visited the Ryugyong General Ophthalmic Hospital Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They looked round outpatient ward, glasses shop and other parts of the hospital.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a congratulatory message from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The floral basket and message were handed to Army General Pak Yong Sik, minister of the People's Armed Forces, on Tuesday by Roman O. Jimenez Ortega, military attache of the Cuban embassy who is doyen of the corps.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The family of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Bao-zhong, a Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and Jong Il Sim, widow of DPRK Hero An Tong Su, sent floral baskets to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.
					 The floral baskets were laid at the statues on Tuesday.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Here
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Here
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Mukesh Sharma, secretary general of the International Kim Jong Il Prize Council, and his party, Henry Masiko, director general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party arrived here on Tuesday to participate in a ceremony of awarding the International Kim Jong Il Prize.
					 Arriving earlier was Alexandr Prokhanov, editor-in-chief of the Zavtra who is a director of the above-said council, and his party.

articles.title: Foreign Figure Skaters Here
articles.content:
Foreign Figure Skaters Here
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Figure skaters from Russia, Hungary, Canada, France and Italy arrived here Tuesday to take part in the 25th Paektusan Prize International Figure Skating Festival for Celebrating the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Arriving earlier were figure skaters of Belarus.

articles.title: China-Residing Koreans Arrive
articles.content:
China-Residing Koreans Arrive
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- China-residing Koreans arrived here on Tuesday to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 They included a congratulatory group of the General Association of Koreans in China led by Vice-Chairman Cha Sang Bo, a delegation of the Association of Korean Business Persons in China led by Phyo Song Ryong and a delegation of the Association for Economic and Cultural Exchange of Korean Nationality in Dandong City of China headed by Chairman Kim Thaek Ryong.

articles.title: Family Members of Persons Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Arrive
articles.content:
Family Members of Persons Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Arrive
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Family members of Chai Shiying and Liu Tong-shi, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and those of Pak Kil Song, a Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr in China, and So Sun Ok, a Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter in China, arrived here on Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Iranian Embassy Gives Reception
articles.content:
Iranian Embassy Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The Iranian embassy here gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club Tuesday on the occasion of the 38th anniversary of the victory of the Islamic revolution of Iran.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Jae, minister of External Economic Relations, Ryu Myong Son, Choe Hui Chol and other officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here, military attaches and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Seyed Mohsen Emadi and his embassy officials were present.

articles.title: AP Vice-President Leaves
articles.content:
AP Vice-President Leaves
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Ian Anthony Phillips, vice-president of the Associated Press, and his party left here Tuesday.

articles.title: Sariwon Orphans' Primary School Completed
articles.content:
Sariwon Orphans' Primary School Completed
 Sariwon, February 14 (KCNA) -- Orphans' Primary School was successfully completed in the area of Taesong-dong, Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province.
					 The school has a four-storey building housing classroom, room for Children's Union organizations and nature study room, a dormitory, a gymnasium, an outdoor wading pool, a canteen and other best amenities for education and living.
					
					 Present at the inaugural ceremony Tuesday were officials concerned, teachers and children of the school, builders and working people in Sariwon City.
					
					 Im Hun, chairman of the North Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee, made a speech.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, the participants went round the school together with schoolchildren
					
					 The schoolchildren moved to the dormitory that day.

articles.title: Construction of Ryomyong Street Nears Completion
articles.content:
Construction of Ryomyong Street Nears Completion
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The construction of Ryomyong Street progresses apace in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK.
					 According to an official concerned, the construction of apartment buildings and facilities has reached upward of 95 percent and 90 percent respectively.
					
					 Elevators were placed in apartment buildings now under completion by soldier-builders and the Ministry of Construction and Building-Materials Industry, Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport, General Bureau for Affairs with Diplomatic Corps, External Construction Guidance Bureau and other units.
					
					 Particularly, apartment houses built by some construction units of the People's Army are fully prepared for new dwellers.
					
					 The construction of public buildings, amenities and infrastructure has also been pushed forward at a final stage and myriads trees of scores of species planted in the street are now under special care.

articles.title: Gifts, Orders, Medals and Honorary Titles to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gifts, Orders, Medals and Honorary Titles to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- More than 40 000 pieces of gifts and over 380 orders, medals and honorary titles were presented to leader Kim Jong Il by more than 170 countries and international bodies and personages representing their profound reverence for him.
					 He received at least 180 orders and medals from various countries, international bodies and personages.
					
					 He was presented with more than 200 honorary titles by state and party leaders and political parties of various countries, world-famous academies of sciences, universities, international bodies, organizations and cities across the world.
					
					 Also, he received diplomas and certificates from the Socialist Political Action Party of Peru, the Peruvian Communist Party, the Bangladesh Jatiya Party, the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, the Bangladesh People's League and the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist) on the occasion of the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Leader Kim Jong Il, Eternal Sun of Juche
articles.content:
Leader Kim Jong Il, Eternal Sun of Juche
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il has been highly praised as the sun by the world progressives for his great virtue and immortal feats.
					 It was the strict commandments of the Orthodox ceremony to ring a bell at midday. But, at a time when he arrived at St. Bishop Innokenty of Irkutsk Church, Russian Orthodox Church during his visit to the Far Eastern Region of Russia in August 2002, a priest of the church rang a bell, saying: "Now a bell is sounded to welcome leader Kim Jong Il. The sun has come to our church. It is natural to sound a bell when the sun has come."
					
					 An international concours winner and famous singer of Russia said that leader Kim Jong Il is an attractive and tender-hearted father. His smile is sunny smile and I saw a man like the sun, she added.
					
					 The Socialist Party of Benin clarified that it would invariably hold Kim Jong Il as its honorary chairman and add luster to his exploits in Benin and the African continent.
					
					 Organizations for the study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism appeared in many countries, including Italy, Bulgaria, Nigeria, South Africa, Mexico, Venezuela and Japan.
					
					 A monument to Kim Jong Il Class was erected at primary school No. 2 in Kuwazana, Zimbabwe.
					
					 Meanwhile, literary works such as "Great Son of Korea", "Sunny Smile" and "Light of Love" written by the world progressives have been translated into different languages.

articles.title: Justice Sure to Triumph and Injustice Go to Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Justice Sure to Triumph and Injustice Go to Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday carries a commentary titled "It is the inevitability of history that justice wins and injustice goes to ruin."
					 The commentary says:
					
					 When Park Geun Hye of south Korea ran for "presidency", there were people having vague expectations for her.
					
					 However, after the flow of time they keenly realized that they were taken in by her mistaken remarks and art of disguise.
					
					 Angered by the incompetence and corrupt politics of Park that ran counter to justice, the south Korean people turned out in the strong resistance to oust her.
					
					 The expected tragic end of the regime tells a lot.
					
					 Whoever goes against the public mind-set, oblivious of the basic mission of the politics which calls for supporting the just mindset is bound to go to ruin.
					
					 Obama stood in the "spotlight" of world opinion even before being inaugurated as president as he was "the first black man to be the boss of the White House" in the history of the U.S. And he was awarded even Nobel Peace Prize for uttering the glossy words "World without nuclear weapons" after his inauguration. However, he was compelled to disappear forever as a fallen leaf of history after being called "the worst U.S. president" as the hostile policy towards the DPRK ended in a total failure.
					
					 Had he not pursued the foolish daydream of stifling the DPRK and resorted to the anachronistic hostile policy of sanctions and military pressure, he would not have faced such miserable fate.
					
					 In this sense, the earlier the U.S. rolls back its anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK and reestablishes the DPRK-U.S. relations, the better.
					
					 The south Korean regime is a puppet colonial one of the U.S. Therefore, no country can get anything from dealing with the puppet regime.
					
					 The aggressive nature and ambition of the imperialist reactionary forces remain unchanged and are getting more reckless as the days go by.
					
					 It is necessary to distinguish a true friend from a heinous enemy and justice from injustice.
					
					 Compromise with injustice would entail only adverse consequences.
					
					 No one should forget history and disregard the priceless tradition they established at the cost of blood.
					
					 It is necessary to face up to the reality from the standpoint of the past and to look far into the future on the basis of the tradition.

articles.title: Minju Joson Ridicules Inane Behavior of S. Korean Lackeys before New U.S. Defense Secretary
articles.content:
Minju Joson Ridicules Inane Behavior of S. Korean Lackeys before New U.S. Defense Secretary 
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The group of lackeys including Hwang Kyo An, acting "president", Kim Kwan Jin, chief of the security office of Chongwadae, Yun Pyong Se, minister of Foreign Affairs, and Han Min Gu, minister of Defense, vied with each other to call on the U.S. defense secretary during his stay in Seoul and raised a hue and cry over "nuclear threat from the north" and implored for "cooperation".
					 Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary terms this a burlesque of psychopaths, obsessed with sycophancy toward the U.S.
					
					 The puppet group's above-said disgusting behavior is no more than the foolish and desperate wriggle of those more dead than alive to seek a way out with the backing of their American master, the commentary says, adding:
					
					 They are fated to go to ruin.
					
					 Owing to the south Korean people's resistance, traitor Park Geun Hye's office as "president" is totally suspended after the motion on her impeachment passed through the "National Assembly" and the same fate awaits her confidants such as Hwang Kyo An, Kim Kwan Jin, Yun Pyong Se and Han Min Gu, accomplices in the scandal. 
					
					 In the true sense of the word, the puppet political camp looks like a house of grief.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that those lackeys have only their master U.S. to count on. 
					
					 It is the U.S. which can install and unseat the "president" of south Korea as it pleases. Therefore, only when they curry favor with their master U.S., they can have their greed for power satisfied or prolong their remaining days. This is the inevitable fate of the sycophants. They are a group of pitiful colonial stooges who cannot survive even a moment without the patronage of the U.S.
					
					 Their servile behavior only reveals their foolish and reckless confrontation hysteria to stifle the compatriots in the north, backed by outside forces.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservatives Denounced for Trying to Check Impeachment of Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservatives Denounced for Trying to Check Impeachment of Park Geun Hye
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China in a statement on Feb. 10 denounced the reckless moves of the conservative group of south Korea to check the impeachment of Park Geun Hye.
					 Chongwadae keen on checking the impeachment of Park is a den of evils working hard to deteriorate the people's living with an unpopular rule and pushing them to death with its deaf ear turned to their voices full of pain, despair, uneasiness, sorrow and grudge, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The cesspool of corruption and scandals is the Park group such as hordes of ultra-right conservatives challenging the public mind-set.
					
					 The political philistines are offering the pro-U.S. conservative forces an opportunity of staying in power, disregarding the public desire for ushering in a new era.
					
					 The Koreans in China will wage unflinching actions to denounce the crimes of Park, Choe Sun Sil and other conservatives, oust Park and foil her gentries' moves for stay in power, the statement stressed.

articles.title: U.S.-resident Korean Praises Marshal Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
U.S.-resident Korean Praises Marshal Kim Jong Un 
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Ri Jun Sik, editorial board member of Minjok Thongsin, an internet newspaper of Koreans in the U.S., in a commentary on January 25 said that the New Year Address of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un has drawn great attention of Koreans at home and abroad.
					 An appeal to the entire Korean nation, adopted on Jan. 18 at the joint conference of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations to realize the proposal of national reunification set forth by Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address, fills the Koreans with national pride and honor, the commentary said, adding:
					
					 This year is a historic year as it marks the 45th anniversary of the publication of the July 4 joint statement and the 10th anniversary of the publication of the October 4 declaration, and to achieve the country's reunification, the cherished desire of our nation, is the supreme task of all Koreans which brooks no further delay.
					
					 Noting that the South Side Preparatory Committee for the Pan-national Conference for Peace and Reunification of the Country and Development of North-South Relations was formed in Seoul on Jan. 19, thanks to the civic and public organizations of different social standings aspiring after the reunification, the commentary stressed that the country is sure to be reunified under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Introduced in Romania
articles.content:
Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Introduced in Romania
Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- Romania's newspaper Romania Muncitoare carried the brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il on February 6 to mark the Day of the Shining Star, his birth anniversary.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Angola
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Angola
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- An Angolan preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, was formed in Luanda on February 8.
					 The international secretary of the Angolan Women's Organization was elected chairperson of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold film show, book and photo exhibition and other political and cultural events in the period from February 8 to April 18.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, the Day of the Shining Star, was formed under the sponsorship of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on February 6.
					 Dolgachev, first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Russian party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Observed in Japan
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Observed in Japan
 Pyongyang, February 14 (KCNA) -- A Japan-DPRK friendship new spring gathering for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, the Day of the Shining Star, was held in Tokyo on February 9.
					 Present there were Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Shingo Kanemaru, secretary for policy of Sin Kanemaru, ex-vice president of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan, Kenki Nakamura, chairman of the Japan-Korea Society for Scientific and Educational Interchange, and other figures of various circles of Japan and Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and officials of Chongryon.
					
					 Its participants watched a video introducing the successes achieved in building a socialist power by the Korean army and people under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea last year.
					
					 Speeches were made.
					
					 Fumihiro Himori said that a great international festival would be held for glorifying the exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt Paektu in significant this year marking the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 75th birth anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, expressing the will to make a positive contribution to the successful holding of the 5th International Festival in Praise of the Great Persons of Mt Paektu.
					
					 Nam Sung U referred to the facts that Kim Jong Il made a gigantic contribution to the struggle for the victory in the cause of independence against imperialism and the socialist cause frustrating all sorts of challenges of the imperialists with his unique Songun politics, and his idea and cause are being successfully carried forward by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He expressed his will to make efforts for the normalization of the DPRK-Japan relations.

articles.title: Inaugurado XXI Festival de Kimjongilias por el Dia de Estrella Luz
articles.content:
Inaugurado XXI Festival de Kimjongilias por el Dia de Estrella Luz
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quedo iniciado en esta capital el XXI Festival de Kimjongilias con el tema de "Kimjongilias florecidas plenamente bendiciendo la era de Kim Jong Un en prosperidad".
					En el presente certamen se exhiben decenas de miles de kimjongilias cultivadas por mas de 80 unidades incluso los organismos de fuerzas armadas, ministerios y organos centrales, los militares del Ejercito Popular, los trabajadores de distintos estratos, los jovenes y ninos escolares del pais. 
					
					Tambien, figuran las ejemplares expuestas por los compatriotas y sus entidades incluso la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon, las representaciones diplomaticas y de organizaciones internacionales acreditadas en Corea, las entidades de amistad y solidaridad de varios paises, las personalidades extranjeras y los chinos residentes en Corea. 
					
					La ceremonia de inauguracion tuvo lugar el dia 14 en la Exposicion Permanente de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia. 
					
					Participaron aqui el vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, el vicepremier Ri Ryong Nam y los funcionarios del comite organizador del festival y unidades exponentes. 
					
					Tambien, estuvieron presentes los compatriotas y sus delegaciones incluso el grupo de felicitacion de coreanos residentes en Japon, encabezada por Ri Ki Sok, asesor del Presidium del Comite Central de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon, que esta de visita en la patria para celebrar el Dia de la Estrella Luz, los miembros de la Asociacion de Apoyo a la Divulgacion de Flores Inmortales y los huespedes extranjeros. 
					
					El presidente del Comite de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia de Corea, Kim Chang Do, pronuncio la palabra de apertura.

articles.title: Tiene lugar mitin de juramento de jovenes y estudiantes
articles.content:
Tiene lugar mitin de juramento de jovenes y estudiantes 
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia de la Estrella luz, tuvo lugar el dia 14 en la Plaza del Palacio del Sol Kumsusan el mitin de juramento de los jovenes y estudiantes para enaltecer al Dirigente Kim Jong Il como eterno Sol del Juche y llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche bajo la orientacion del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un. 
					Asistieron los funcionarios de la Union de la Juventud y de ramas interesadas, los jovenes y estudiantes de la capital.
					
					Los participantes rindieron el sublime homenaje a los grandes Lideres hacia sus imagenes sonrientes. 
					
					El primer secretario del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Kimilsungista-Kimjongilista, Jon Yong Nam, presento el informe y seguidamente hubo intervenciones.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que al prestar siempre profunda atencion al problema de la juventud, el Dirigente desarrollo la Union de la Juventud como un destacamento vanguardista con el nombre del Presidente Kim Il Sung y entrego a la juventud coreana la antorcha de la revolucion practicando la politica de dar importancia a la juventud, no vista en la historia de la humanidad.
					
					Enfatizaron que el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, quien continua con brillantez las proezas de los grandes Lideres antecesores realizadas en la construccion de la potencia de la juventud, fortalecio la Union de la Juventud como la Kimilsungista-Kimjongilista y dirige sabiamente para que los jovenes coreanos cumplan satisfactoriamente con su honrosa mision y deber asumidos ante el Partido y la revolucion como fidedigno destacamento de reserva, patrulla y unidad de flanco del Partido. 
					
					Manifestaron las decisiones de levantar sobre el territorio patrio una potencia socialista en prosperidad de tipo jucheano apoyando con fidelidad la orientacion del Maximo Dirigente.

articles.title: Celebran el Dia de Estrella Luz en entidades de masas
articles.content:
Celebran el Dia de Estrella Luz en entidades de masas
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 14 en las entidades de masas los actos y funciones artisticas en homenaje al 75o aniversario del natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					Estuvieron presentes en las ocasiones los funcionarios interesados y de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea y la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea, los obreros y gremiales de la FGSC, los trabajadores agricolas e integrantes de la UTAC. 
					
					En el acto de obreros y gremiales celebrado en la Casa Central de Obreros, el presidente del Comite Central de la FGSC, Ju Yong Gil, presento el informe y hubo intervenciones. 
					
					Los oradores dijeron que el nacimiento del Dirigente como lucero del Paektu fue una gran fortuna para la nacion coreana y acontecimiento historico mundial que garantizo el futuro maravilloso de la causa revolucionaria del Juche y la de independencia de la humanidad. 
					
					Destacaron que su vida revolucionaria fue la mas brillante del gran hombre quien con su noble mision ante la patria y la revolucion, voluntad de acero, larga prevision y destacada direccion, defendio el destino de la nacion y dedico todo lo suyo por la felicidad del pueblo. 
					
					Llamaron a todos a enaltecerle como eterno Sol del Juche y luchar con dinamismo por la victoria final de la causa revolucionaria del Juche uniendose mas compactamente en torno al Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un. 
					
					El acto de festejo de los trabajadores agricolas e integrantes de la UTAC tuvo lugar en la Casa Cultural del distrito de Kwaksan. 
					
					Terminado el acto, se ofrecio una funcion artistica. 
					
					Los ejecutantes alabaron las imborrables proezas revolucionarias de Kim Jong Il quien durante toda su vida consagrada por la prosperidad de la patria y la felicidad del pueblo, allano la via para hacer siempre feliz y prospera a la nacion de Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Otorgado el Premio Internacional Kim Jong Il a Kenichi Ogami
articles.content:
Otorgado el Premio Internacional Kim Jong Il a Kenichi Ogami
Pyongyang, 14 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Consejo del Premio Internacional Kim Jong Il decidio otorgar el Premio Internacional Kim Jong Il a Kenichi Ogami, secretario general del Instituto Internacional de la Idea Juche, quien es el ferviente adepto a la idea Juche e hizo aporte especial al cumplimiento de la causa de la paz y la de verificacion de la independencia en el mundo entero. 
					Fue publicada el dia 14 la resolucion correspondiente del Consejo.
